item.title: Frontend Digest - 2023 / 27
item.content:encoded:
The og√≥rkowy period, it's a period where the most people have their holidays. It's often a good way to just forget about your work, and let you spoil yourself with not reading our digest ;)

Last week‚Äôs digest was not published, hope you did not forget about us! In a return, this digest consists of twice as many articles as usual. Let us know if you‚Äôd prefer to read less often but condensed.

üíé Highlight of the Last Two Weeks

It was indeed hard to choose a single highlight from the last two weeks. However, the Dev Mode from Figma, requires a special highlight, as it has put DX on a different, much higher level!

Per citation: ‚ÄúDev Mode in Figma design gives developers everything they need to navigate design files and transform designs into code. With Dev Mode, designers and developers stay on the same page, making sure important details aren‚Äôt lost in the handoff process.‚Äù

üìé Thought-Provoking Bits

  • How to check the number for being a prime number? Use a regular expression.
  • Wanting to create a web-based game? But the technology holds you back? This may not be an issue anymore.
  • React Server Components lead to abandon, an open source project. It‚Äôs a bad thing? Stitches team has decided to stop maintaining their library, however they now can focus even more on other great projects. Sometimes starting fresh is a more valuable than a refactor.
  • Hot change: Change your ESLint issues to be all warnings. So it‚Äôs easier to distinguish them from TypeScript errors. Sounds good?
  • The introduction of AI in MDN has moved the community. ‚ÄúThey're losing the trust that they were building.‚Äù Read more about this change and discussion regarding it, here.
  • Did you know, CSS has a round() function? Here's a demo of it.
  • ES2023 features ‚ÄúChange Array by Copy‚Äù (available in all major browsers). Very excited, no more copying arrays everywhere. More can be found here.
  • W3C has a new website!
  • Are you using GitHub Copilot in your work or a project? Here‚Äôs a handy article, how to more efficient use it, from the authors behind the assistant.
  • Svelte team has released the 4th version of their library!

üì¶ Useful Whatchamacallits

  • Tier - a single tool to configure, orchestrate and manage your entire pricing stack.
  • Block Suite - an open-source collaborative editor project behind AFFiNE.
  • Call To Inspiration - Digital Purple Hat for UX Designers & Developers.
  • InfiniteUI - beautiful Tailwind components for your next projectin one library, prompted by humans and designed by AI.
  • mxcn - 172-byte utility library to use bothclsx and tailwind-merge in one go.
  • refine.new - open-source enterprise application platform for serious web developers
  • Volar.js - A rationally designed framework for building embedded programming language tools. Incubated from Vue ecosystem.

ü§† Bi-weekly meme

item.title: Frontend Digest - 2023 / 29
item.content:encoded:
üíé Highlight of the Week

Chrome supports SolidJS in building a performant web.

SolidJS team announces that the Chrome team will be contributing $30,000 towards their continued performance research through The Aurora Project. Aurora funds improvements to Core Web Vitals in open source frameworks.

The goal here is to support general adoption on the new technology that allowed them to build a full client-navigated server-rendered app that scored top marks in Lighthouse page metrics and had 1/10th the JavaScript payload of the most popular solutions.

Client-side routing without the JavaScript? Sounds pretty exciting! We'll see how it goes.

üìé Thought-Provoking Bits

  • Prisma 5: Faster by Default - new major release of Prisma that introduces changes that masatike it significantly faster
  • Learn how to use the TypeScript new satisfies operator
  • A Brief History of Web Apps - why Qwik is Innovative
  • Is there a way to leverage your experience from working in restaurant while writing software? Jason Lengstorf encourages to clean as you go.
  • Tailwind CSS Tips and Tricks Worth Knowing
  • Effect - TypeScript That Scales
  • Invisible Details of Interaction Design
  • Have you ever struggled with Text content does not match server-rendered HTML error in Next.js? Documentation to the rescue!
  • Learn how to use Material UI with the Next.js App Router
  • Remove Route-based Dialogs (and breadcrumbs are great) - Epic Stack announcement by Kent C. Dodds
  • How To Build a Multi-Tenant App With Payload CMS
  • Remix Full Stack Components vs. Server Components
  • Common design patterns at Stripe
  • How to master advanced TypeScript patterns
  • Replace axios with a simple custom fetch wrapper
  • How to render a server component inside a client component
  • Basketball game in React Three Fiber / Three.js
  • First Payload CMS database adapter
  • How to make marquee animations with Tailwind CSS
  • TailwindGPT in making - ChatGPT for TailwindCSS
  • Chaos test your UI against long strings - fluggaenkoecchicebolsenü§î
  • Use discriminated unions in React props
  • Custom useMultipleRefs hook
  • Should React Client Components be the deafult in Next.js v13?
  • Experimental react-query-nextjs package released

üì¶ Useful Whatchamacallits

  • prisma-extension-pagination - Prisma Client extension for pagination
  • ProtonPass - open-source and encrypted password manager
  • medusa - building blocks for digital commerce
  • nextjs-starter-medusa - combine Medusa's modules for your commerce backend with the newest Next.js 13 features for a performant storefront
  • next-international - type-safe internationalization (i18n) for Next.js
  • Dragonfly - multi-threaded Redis replacement built for modern cloud workloads

ü§† Weekly meme
